name: GetProjectActivityById
description: Use this endpoint to load a single Project Activity by id/number.

$ul:
**activityNumber**: The number of the activity that is linked to the project.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte, in, nin

Sortable: false

**completed**: If set to true, registration on the project is no longer allowed.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte

Sortable: false

**endDate**: The date when registration on the project activity stops being allowed.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte

Sortable: false

**number**: The system unique number of the project activity entry. This property is not visible in the UI.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte, in, nin

Sortable: true

**objectVersion**: The object version, required for PUT requests.

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**projectNumber**: The number of the project that the activity is linked to.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte, in, nin

Sortable: false

**responsibleEmployeeNumber**: The number of the employee that is responsible for the project activity.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte, in, nin

Sortable: false

**startDate**: The date when registration on the project activity starts being allowed.

Filterable: eq, ne, lt, lte, gt, gte

Sortable: false

**developerHint**: Some hints for the developer that might help avoid the error.

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**errorCode**: The error code.

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**logId**: The unique log identifier of the error.

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**logTimeUtc**: The UTC time of the error being logged.

Read-only: true

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**message**: Short description about the error.

Filterable: not filterable

Sortable: false

**property**: The property name in case of validation logic issue.
